snippet: Six of the nine unions that sued over the state’s 2011 pension system overhaul agreed to the tentative settlement, which affects 59,000 current and past workers.
abstract: Rhode Island reaches tentative agreement with most of its public employee unions over sweeping legal challenge to 2011 pension overhaul; changes include adjustment to minimum retirement age and more frequent cost-of-living increases; will affect some 59,000 current and past state employees.
lead_paragraph: Six of the nine unions that sued over the state’s 2011 pension system overhaul agreed to the tentative settlement, which affects 59,000 current and past workers.

headline.main: Rhode Island Settles Lawsuit on Union Pension Overhaul
headline.print_headline: Rhode Island Settles Lawsuit on Union Pension Overhaul
